==Japanese==

===Etymology===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|トド|胡獱 (Steller sea lion)}}
{{wikipedia|Steller sea lion}}
[[File:Steller_sea_lions_(Eumetopias_jubatus)_on_rocks.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|海馬}} (''todo''): a female and male '''[[Steller sea lion]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=とど}}

{{bor|ja|ain|sort=とど|トド|tr=todo}} or {{m|ain|トト|tr=toto||sea lion}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The kanji spelling is an instance of {{juku|sort=とど}} from the older term ''kohin'' (see below).

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=i|とど|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}
* {{hmp|lang=ja|椴|鯔}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|海馬}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|とど|トド}}

# a {{l|en|Steller sea lion}}

=====Usage notes=====
{{U:ja:biology|トド}} The kanji spellings are rare. When written in kanji, the {{lang|ja|胡獱}} spelling may be more common, likely to avoid confusion with the alternate readings of the {{ja-l|海馬}} spelling of ''umiuma'' and ''kaiba''.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こ|ひん}}

Appears to be a coinage in Japan of {{cog|ltc|-}}-derived elements, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=こひん|胡|tr1=ko|t1=reckless|獱|tr2=hin|t2=otter|pos2=by extension, in reference to a marine mammal}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|こひん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こひん}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=こひん|archaic|possibly|_|obsolete}} a {{l|en|Steller sea lion}}

=====Usage notes=====
The ''kohin'' reading has been {{l|en|supersede}}d by the {{cog|ain|-}} borrowing ''todo'' above.
